ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A a german language class, the level of german is manageable and you will find you improve a lot as the class goes on. There is quite a lot of reading in german, but it goes at a steady pace. HIGHLY recommend this class - the works and theories are interesting, and the teaching is wonderful.
Super fun and helpful German course! I highly highly recommend it for anyone who wants to improve both their oral and written German skills!
Take it! It's a great course. Very much fun and informative.
This is a great introduction to German theater. The readings are interesting and the course load is never overbearing. I feel like GMAN 172 has really helped me improve my German skills.

GMAN 172 is a broad survey course in German theater. I would recommend it to anyone who is interested in the topic and is at least conversant in German. Students leave understanding not only a handful of German plays, but also the broad movements within German drama over the course of four centuries.
Yes, take it because it's a focused German class and Prof. North is engaging.

Not a bad course. We got to read a lot of good stuff, but sometimes the discussions were not very productive--in a literary sense, that is. Spending a lot of time speaking did help my German though, even if the intellectual content was not very well expressed.
Highly recommended with appropriate language skills
